title: Urban air quality: new research highlights emerging challenges and solutions
content:
New York City skyline. Credit: NYC.gov
Urban air pollution remains a pressing challenge, with millions of people exposed to harmful pollutants daily. Understanding the sources, chemistry, and patterns of exposure is crucial for crafting effective policies. Three recent studies funded in part by the Climate Program Officeâ€™s Atmospheric Chemistry, Carbon Cycle and Climate (AC4) program shed light on different aspects of this issue, offering new insights into how emissions, atmospheric chemistry, and urban environments shape air quality.
